items.title: Trump’s Sweeping Tariffs Face High-Stakes Supreme Court Test
items.summary: Justices will hear arguments on Wednesday over whether the president acted legally when he used a 1977 emergency statute to unilaterally impose tariffs.

items.title: As Government Shutdown Stalemate Persists, Frustration Defies Party Lines
items.summary: The partisan divisions in Washington are as deep as ever, but some voters in both parties have grown weary of the standoff and want it to end.

items.title: A Big Win in California Propels Newsom
items.summary: The passage of Proposition 50 cemented Gov. Gavin Newsom’s position as President Trump’s chief antagonist and raised his national political profile.

items.title: A Muslim Mayor in New York City? Voters Say Yes, Emphatically.
items.summary: Zohran Mamdani shattered a barrier that seemed insurmountable since the Sept. 11 attacks changed what it meant to be Muslim in the city.

items.title: Tariffs Are Here to Stay, Even if the Supreme Court Rules Against Trump
items.summary: The Trump administration says it has plenty of other options to impose tariffs, if the court rules against the president.

items.title: Californian wait in long lines to vote on Prop. 50
Democrat Zohran Mamdani sweeps to victory in New York City mayoral election and lays down challenge to Trump - live
items.summary: <p>The 34-year-old democratic socialist secured victory with more than 50% of the vote</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/04/zohran-mamdani-mayor-new-york-city">Zohran Mamdani elected mayor of New York City</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/04/california-prop-50-voting-result">Prop 50: Californians pass redistricting measure</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/04/nyc-mayoral-election-results-zohran-mamdani-andrew-cuomo-voting-polls">NYC mayoral election results</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/05/share-your-views-new-york-mayoral-election-results">Share your views on the New York result</a></p></li></ul><p>Let’s take a look at the breakdown of the vote across the New York boroughs:<br><br> Mamdani was able to build a broad coalition of supporters across several bases- everyone from working-class immigrants to younger, liberal voters. Across the city, they turned out in droves – and this surge triumphed over Cuomo’s base which was boosted by Republican voters.</p><p>It was such a landslide that within 35 minutes of the polls closing, Associated Press had called the race for the city’s first Muslim mayor and the youngest in a century.</p><p>“TRUMP WASN’T ON THE BALLOT, AND SHUTDOWN, WERE THE TWO REASONS THAT REPUBLICANS LOST ELECTIONS TONIGHT,” according to Pollsters”</p><p>“… AND SO IT BEGINS!”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/05/zohran-mamdani-new-york-nyc-donald-trump-mayor-election-california-new-jersey-virginia-latest-news-results">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Zohran Mamdani elected New York City mayor | First Thing
items.summary: <p>Democratic socialist’s campaign was fueled by small-dollar donations and tens of thousands of volunteers. Plus, Dick Cheney dies aged 84</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/info/2018/sep/17/guardian-us-morning-briefing-sign-up-to-stay-informed"><strong>Don’t already get First Thing in your inbox? Sign up here</strong></a></p><p></p></li></ul><p>Good morning.</p><p>The Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani has been <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/04/zohran-mamdani-mayor-new-york-city">elected as the 111th mayor of New York City</a>, defeating the former governor Andrew Cuomo and the Republican candidate Curtis Sliwa.</p><p><strong>How did the New York vote go?</strong> Mamdani received more votes than all the other candidates combined. With 97% of votes counted, he was on 50.4% of the total, while Cuomo was on 41.6% and Sliwa on 7.1%.</p><p><strong>What does it mean for the city?</strong> Mamdani <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/nov/05/wednesday-briefing-improbable-victory-for-citys-first-muslim-mayor-offers-new-playbook-for-fight-against-trump">wants to</a> freeze rent for 2 million people, to raise the minimum wage to $30 an hour, increase taxes on the highest earners, make bus transit free, offer universal childcare and increase affordable housing provision, among other things. The question now is how much of that platform he can deliver.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/05/first-thing-zohran-mamdani-elected-new-york-city-mayor">Continue reading...</a>
